ygData.subject: Re: Deleting /friend list (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: Looks like the friends list is stored in the eqOptions1.opt file. Not sure if you can edit out entries safely, or if you need to delete the file and have EQ
ygData.messageBody:
Looks like the friends list is stored in the eqOptions1.opt file. Not sure
if you can edit out entries safely, or if you need to delete the file and
have EQ generate a new one on application start.

Bernwyn


----- Original Message -----
From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2000 4:25 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Deleting /friend list (OT)


> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> Is there anyway to delete your entire /friend list and start over? I
typed
> in /friend to see who all was listed on there that I hadn't seen in a long
> time. I noticed that there were a couple of phrases listed in addition to
> players. Apparently I thought I was sending a /tell, /say, or /groupsay
but
> instead I hit "/f" instead of "/t" so I ended up adding the phrase I typed
> to my friend list. When I type in /friend and get the entire list, there
are
> a few blank spaces in front of the phrases. I have made numerous attempts
> at removing the phrase by adding one, two, three, etc spaces before I type
> in any letters. All this does is add another phrase to my friend list.
>
> I thinking if I delete my characters .opt file in the EQ directory this
will
> delete my friends list as well as all my hotkeys. Will this work? My
> friends list is full so I need to free up the slots.
>
> Thanks
> Galtin of E'ci
>
